The Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited, Tiruchi, would contribute Rs.15.2 lakhs for construction of toilets at the Government Aided Primary School at Asoor and Government Panchayat Union Primary School at Thuvakudi under its corporate social responsibility (CSR) programme. The toilets will be constructed by Health and Welfare Services Trust of Lion’s Club of Tiruverumbur under the Swachh Bharat Mission. BHEL is also contributing Rs.10 lakh for the construction of toilets in Thuvakudi municipal area. BHEL authorities entered into separate memorandum of understanding with the Health and Welfare Services Trust of Lions Club of Tiruverumbur and the Thuvakudi Municipality on Friday, according to a BHEL press release.

Water shutdown

Drinking water supply would remain suspended to the following areas of the city on Saturday owing to a leak in the water mains from the Kambarasampettai Water Works: Marakkadai, Viragupettai, Rockfort, Chinthamani, Thillai Nagar, Anna Nagar, Puthur, Khajapettai, Cantonment, Junction, Uyyakondan Thirumalai, South Ramalinga Nagar, Alpha Nagar, Fathima Nagar, Karumandapam and Khajamalai. Work is under way to repair the pipeline and regular supply would be restored to these areas on Sunday, Corporation Commissioner M. Vijayalakshmi said in a press release.

Science practical

All private candidates who have been applied to appear for the March 2016 SSLC examination should appear for the science practical examination, V.Murugan, Regional Deputy Director of Government Examination, said in a press release. The practical examinations are to be held from February 22, he said. Candidates who have failed in the practical examination can also appear for the same.
title: BHEL funds for toilets in school
